meanings.definition: A mechanical seal that fills the space between two mating surfaces to prevent leakage.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic replaced the worn gaskets in the car engine to stop the oil leak.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to check the gaskets in your pipes regularly to avoid any water leaks.
meanings.sent3: Why did the gaskets go to the party? To seal the deal!
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted like gaskets, sealing away her true feelings from others.
meanings.sent5: The gaskets in the dam held back the water like a strong barrier.

meanings.definition: A ring or sheet of rubber or other material used to seal a joint or connection.
meanings.sent1: The plumber used gaskets to ensure there were no leaks in the pipe connections.
meanings.sent2: The gaskets around the window frame helped keep the cold air out of the house.
meanings.sent3: The rubber gaskets were so excited to be sealing the leaky faucet.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like gaskets, sealing their friendship with trust and loyalty.
meanings.sent5: The gaskets in the submarine hatch kept the water out, protecting the crew inside.
